channel.title: Repeat An Action

item.title: Repeat An Action
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

Make a method that does everything in there.

if(objectID == 5551 || objectID == 1308) { if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 6739 == true) { if(playerLevel[8] >= 30) if(actionTimer == 0) { cutSomeWood(); } else if(playerLevel[14] < 40) { sendMessage("You need 40 Woodcutting to cut this tree!"); } else { sendMessage("You need a Dragon Axe to cut this tree!"); } }

public void cutSomeWood() { sendMessage("you kick against the willow tree!"); setAnimation(0x875); addSkillXP((50*playerLevel[8]), 8); addItem(995, 10900); actionTimer += 1; if(actionTimer == 5) { replaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 1342); }

Something like that might work.

Read full topic

item.title: Repeat An Action
item.dc:creator: @Gazmask Gazmask
item.description:
@Gazmask wrote:

I have just made my little own Woodcutting case that works wuup
but the only problem you need to repeat the clicking everytime
what do you need to add to make it repeat for it self ?
the code :


if(objectID == 5551 || objectID == 1308)
{
if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 6739 == true)
{
if(playerLevel[8] >= 30)
if(actionTimer == 0)
{
sendMessage("you kick against the willow tree!");
setAnimation(0x875);
addSkillXP((50*playerLevel[8]), 8);
addItem(995, 10900);
actionTimer = 5;
}
}
else if(playerLevel[14] < 40) {
sendMessage("You need 40 Woodcutting to cut this tree!");
}
else {
sendMessage("You need a Dragon Axe to cut this tree!");
}
}

Thanks in advance

Read full topic
